Events that occurred on 21 October.

content.title: On Earth
content.content:
1925 – J.R.R. Tolkien submits his resignation from Leeds, his employment will officially end on 31 December 1925.
1926 – J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to Willard G. Harding.
1929 – Author Ursula K. Le Guin born.
1936 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 8c.
1952 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 134a.
1955 – J.R.R. Tolkien presents his paper English and Welsh.
1963 – J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to Mrs. Munby.
1972 – Actor Felix Felton dies.
2004 – The 50th Anniversary Edition of The Lord of the Rings is published.
2008 – Fantasy novel The Indigo King, featuring J.R.R. Tolkien as a fictional character, is published.
2010 – In a press release, it is confirmed that Martin Freeman will play Bilbo Baggins in The Hobbit (film series).

content.title: In Arda
content.content:
F.A. 495:
Tuor, guided by Voronwë, travels to Gondolin in order to deliver Ulmo's message to Turgon.
T.A. 3018:
Frodo recovers from his wound in Rivendell.
Boromir travels towards Rivendell to ask for counsel.
